abstract: Downfall of former NFL star Aaron Hernandez, convicted of first-degree murder and sentenced to life without parole for murder of Odin Lloyd, seems linked to shady past that he could not escape; Hernandez is also awaiting trial in 2012 murder of two men during drive-by shooting in Boston, for which he has pleaded not guilty; both cases involve associates from Hernandez's rough upbringing in Bristol, Conn.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Hernandez, the former N.F.L. star who was convicted of first-degree murder on Wednesday, was thought to have the golden ticket out of a rough-and-tumble upbringing in Bristol, Conn.

headline.main: Aaron Hernandez Shed Tackles, but Not His Past
headline.print_headline: N.F.L. Star, Guilty of Murder, Shed Tackles but Not His Past

snippet: Mr. Hernandez, the former N.F.L. star who was convicted of first-degree murder on Wednesday, was thought to have the golden ticket out of a rough-and-tumble upbringing in Bristol, Conn.
